intro: Henningia unaiensis, commonly known as the Brazilian rock cress, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. Henningia unaiensis is often found in open areas such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
